name: Four Points by Sheraton Munchen Olympiapark

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night during our stay in Munich. This is a 4 star SPG (Starwood Preferred Guest) property when it not anywhere close to being 4 stars. The hotel is extremely basic:
reviews.title: Extremely Average & Not 4 Stars!

reviews.text: - there are no porters. Carry and manage your own luggage
reviews.title: Good location for Olympia Park & BMW Welt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - no bar. no lounge. Just one small lobby with reception and a quarter of the reception desk for a bar.
reviews.title: Convenient to BMW Welt

reviews.text: - no swimming pool
reviews.title: Convenient for Olympic Park & BMW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - no air conditioning
reviews.title: Ok for the price - consider the location
Good enough for short business stay
reviews.text: When you need to be in Olympia Park, this is a recommendable place to stay. Sober but clean and well priced. Parking next to the front door. Rooms are ok.

reviews.title: Good for the price
reviews.text: I have stayed twice at this hotel in the past four years. My experience from both stays are consistent. Yes, the hotel is relatively far from the city center, but you also pay less for your room. The rooms are very clean, not very big, but just big enough. It is very easy to get to the city center from the hotel. The subway station is just around the end of the building, and to get to Marienplatz, you don't even need to change lines.

reviews.title: okay business hotel
reviews.text: The best thing I like about this hotel is its location in a residential area. There's a convenient shopping strip right outside of the front door, although everything closes pretty early. In the morning, you can walk to the bakery, enjoy a cup of coffee while watching the locals going to school and work. Being part of their daily routine gives you a different type of cultural experience.

stayed here since i had some extra spg points to spend for two nights on the recommendation of a friend. the hotel is located far away from most things in munich, but next to olympia park and bmw welt/museum. the metro is close by. it's located on the top 3 floors of what appears to be a condo/apartment building. staff were attentive, and the rooms well appointed, however the lack of A/C made staying there in july very uncomfortable. it is probably okay for business travelers but i wouldn't recommend it for sightseeing, the distance from most sights makes it a trek to get back to your hotel. there are no close by restaurants open at night, only small bakeries in the morning. there are also several grocery stores next by but all close quite early. oh...don't eat in the lobby. we got in late the first night from fussen and wanted a no nonsense dinner so we ordered a burger and fries and also a pizza. i have never had so much salt on fries in my life, it was inedible, and the burger was smothered in tomato sauce (presumably the same stuff they put on the pizza). pizza was average. i think my blood pressure went up 40 points that night from the salt intake. just a bit of advice anyway.
reviews.title: Solid stay at the Four Points in Munich

reviews.text: We only stayed one day as Munich was a transit city for us but we were happy with our stay
reviews.title: Good location for BMW pickup, but no A/C

reviews.text: This is a solid middle class hotel. It's located in the 1972 Olympic village and offers a great view either direction to the Allianz Arena (home pitch of Bayern Munich), which is nicely illuminated at night, or the Olympic Park.
reviews.title: Solid middle class hotel with very friendly staff

reviews.text: Check in and Check Out are very quick. Standard rooms are ok, not too spacious though. But always clean and tidy, so is the bathroom. Executive rooms have more space. Furniture is fine. Plasma TV with a reasonable selection of channels.
reviews.title: Cool views but hot in the summer

reviews.text: Free WiFi is available for the first 24 hours. The speed is limited, but ok for checking mails and surfing the web. If you need more speed, you can "upgrade".
reviews.title: Turn on the lights!!!

reviews.text: Breakfast selection in the restaurant is also ok. Nothing outstanding, but everything you expect in that hotel category. Lunch and dinner is also served in the restaurant. The menu is small with classics like pasta, pizza etc. Nothing you would have for a nice set dinner, but ok for a quick bite after a long working day.
reviews.title: Good staff.

reviews.text: The surrounding of the hotel is very good. There is the subway very close, as well as the Olympic Park, where you can go for a walk or jog.
reviews.title: Adequate hotel, stellar breakfast
Basic, clean accommodations walking distance to BMW & convenient to the train
reviews.text: It's a Sheraton 4 points. It is what it is. Well located, simple, quiet and clean. Staff was helpful and friendly although we had to plead to be upgraded from a postage sized room to an average sized one. Probably because our stay was on points but with our status, it should have been offered if there was availability.

reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, very convenient for BMW Munich plant/HQ and Olympiapark.
reviews.text: NB: The location was a bit difficult to find as it occupies just a few floors of an office building. GPS sends you the underground parking lot first.

reviews.title: Nice and pleasant hotel
reviews.text: Stayed here for business. The hotel is located in the same tower block as apartments. It's a little odd as the lobby is on the ground floor and all the rooms are on the 13th-15th floors. There are shops catering to the residents around the bottom (grocery store, bakeries, bank, döner kebabs etc) which can be convenient. The nearest u-bahn station is an easy 5 minute walk away. In cold weather it is good to be so close.

reviews.title: CONVENIENT & GOOD VALUE!
reviews.text: My room was on the small side but fine for the purpose. The room includes a fridge, coffee maker and iron. Both wired and wireless Internet are available and unlike many hotels in Munich the speed has been usable. This may be because the hotel was not full so your mileage may vary. The desk staff have been very friendly.

reviews.title: Nice clean room
reviews.text: Breakfast is ok but the breakfast room is small and the selection is disappointing compared to other hotels I've stayed at in Munich. My rate included breakfast, if not I would be tempted by the local bakeries which offer breakfast for around €4.

aka: Four Points By Sheraton Munchen Olympiapark Hotel Munich
